page.title: 11NEW ABBEY - INDUSTRY (2)
page.content: The Grain mill is at Lochhill Farm and employs five people operating the cubing plant, mixer and grinder. At harvest time one man is fully employed drying grain. Cereals bought locally and from the Borders are mixed with imported maize, soya and linseed to make animal feed- stuffs. The plant produces 150 tonnes a week in the form of dairy cubes for milk cows, rearing cake, replacer pellets for young cattle, poultry meal, mixed grains for hens, pig meal and sheep feed. There are seven lorries which take feedstuffs in bags to farms and bring raw materials from Glasgow, Edinburgh and Liverpool. Hay and straw are also bought and sold. Treacle is becoming a popular supplement and is delivered by our own tanker.
